term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - response constant in electroanalytical chemistry
term.title: response constant

item.text: A quantity whose expression includes a current, whose value is characteristic of a charge-transfer process and the experimental conditions under which it is investigated, and whose nature depends on the technique that is employed. Some typical response constants are the diffusion current constant in polarography, the voltammetric constant in linear-sweep voltammetry, and the chronopotentiometric constant in chronopotentiometry.

item.title: diffusion current constant in polarography (in polarography)
